title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 581-2.8 - Referrals to the Attorney General
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 581-2.8 - Referrals to the Attorney General

State Regulations

An alleged violation of the statutes and regulations
administered by the agency, of any permit or order issued by the agency or its
designee, of any agreement administratively resolving a violation, or a refusal
to comply with a request for access to property or information involving a
violation or to redress ongoing damage to the natural resources of the

Adirondack Park, may be referred to the Attorney General pursuant to section
63
of the

Executive Law and section 813 of the Act or the relevant provisions of the ECL
as follows: (a) by the executive
director with the advice and consent of the chairperson(s) of the enforcement
committee; or
(b) by the
enforcement committee or the agency. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
581-2.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
